front.title: Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Recording Call Flows

abstract.t: Session recording is a critical requirement in many communications environments, such as call centers and financial trading organizations. In some of these environments, all calls must be recorded for regulatory, compliance, and consumer protection reasons. The recording of a session is typically performed by sending a copy of a media stream to a recording device. This document lists call flows with metadata snapshots sent from a Session Recording Client(SRC) to a Session Recording Server(SRS).
